abstract.text: Adds an action to the context menu by using an image provided by your WatchKit extension.

inlineContent.text: Elevate important items out of such menus and into the relevant screen or a settings screen.

inlineContent.text: The template image to be used for the action. Only the alpha channel of the image is used. This parameter must not be
. For information about the dimensions for menu images, see
The title string to be displayed underneath the image. Title strings should be reasonably short. Any text that cannot be displayed is truncated. This parameter must not be
The action method to be called when the action is tapped. The method must be defined on the current interface controller object. This parameter must not be
Use this method to append an action to the interface controllerâ€™s context menu. If the menu already has four items, additional items are ignored.

abstract.text: Build watchOS apps that use features the app delegate monitors or controls, such as background tasks and extended runtime sessions.
A class that provides the infrastructure for managing the interface in a watchOS app.
Adds an action to the context menu by using an image provided by your WatchKit extension.
Adds an action to the context menu using a system-provided icon.
Adds an action to the context menu using an existing image resource in your Watch app bundle.
Tells the system that you are about to start a potentially lengthy update task for your glance.
Removes all programmatically added actions from the context menu.
Tells the system that you finished updating your glance content.
Loads the specified interface controllers and rebuilds the appâ€™s page-based interface.
Registers the current user activity with the system.
Template images that you can use for menus.
Keys for retrieving text response information.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
An object that manages image data in your app.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
